# clearColor

**Instance Property**

The color to use when clearing the color attachment.

## Declaration

```swift
var clearColor: MTLClearColor { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLRenderPassAttachmentDescriptor/loadAction] property of the attachment is set to [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/clear], then at the start of a render pass, the GPU fills the texture with the value stored in the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLRenderPassColorAttachmentDescriptor/clearColor] property. Otherwise, the GPU ignores the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLRenderPassColorAttachmentDescriptor/clearColor] property.

The [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLRenderPassColorAttachmentDescriptor/clearColor] property represents a set of RGBA components. The default value is `(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0)` (black). Use the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLClearColorMake(_:_:_:_:)] function to construct an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLClearColor] value.

## Specifying clearing value

- **MTLClearColorMake(_:_:_:_:)**: Returns a color value used to clear a color attachment.
